Generation III.Ruby: Aggron claims an entire mountain as its own territory. It mercilessly beats up anything that violates its environment. This Pok é mon vigilantly patrols its territory at all times.
Generation III.Sapphire: Aggron is surprisingly protective of its environment. If its mountain is ravaged by a landslide or a fire, this Pok é mon will haul topsoil to the area, plant trees, and beautifully restore its own territory.
Generation III.Emerald: Its iron horns grow longer a little at a time. They are used to determine the Aggron 's age. The gouges in its armor are worn with pride as mementos from battles.
Generation III.FireRed: It claims a large mountain as its sole territory. It mercilessly thrashes those that violate its space.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It claims a large mountain as its sole territory. It mercilessly thrashes those that violate its space.

Generation IV.Diamond: While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by breaking through bedrock with its steel horns.
Generation IV.Pearl: While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by breaking through bedrock with its steel horns.
Generation IV.Platinum: While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by breaking through bedrock with its steel horns.
Generation IV.HeartGold: You can tell its age by the length of its iron horns. It claims an entire mountain as its territory.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: You can tell its age by the length of its iron horns. It claims an entire mountain as its territory.

Generation V.Black: While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by breaking through bedrock with its steel horns.
Generation V.White: While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by breaking through bedrock with its steel horns.
Generation V.Black 2: It claims an entire mountain as its own. The more wounds it has, the more it has battled, so don't take it lightly.
Generation V.White 2: It claims an entire mountain as its own. The more wounds it has, the more it has battled, so don't take it lightly.

Generation VI.X: It claims an entire mountain as its own. The more wounds it has, the more it has battled, so don't take it lightly.
Generation VI.Y: While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by breaking through bedrock with its steel horns.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Aggron claims an entire mountain as its own territory. It mercilessly beats up anything that violates its environment. This Pokémon vigilantly patrols its territory at all times.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Aggron is protective of its environment. If its mountain is ravaged by a landslide or a fire, this Pokémon will haul topsoil to the area, plant trees, and beautifully restore its own territory.

Generation VIII.Sword: Aggron has a horn sharp enough to perforate thick iron sheets. It brings down its opponents by ramming into them horn first.
Generation VIII.Shield: Long ago, there was a king who wore a helmet meant to resemble the head of an Aggron. He was trying to channel the Pokémon's strength.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by breaking through bedrock with its steel horns.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by breaking through bedrock with its steel horns.
